result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquise D Lloyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
No contact with drug dealers or any known drug houses.

Provide DNA Sample and pay costs. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
The Court will grant expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of ALL terms and conditions of probation.

timeConds.notes: With work release privileges. To report by noon on 7-25-14.
Perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.

ADDRESS INFO for Marquise D Lloyd
Current: 4228 West Fond Du Lac Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216-3528 United States  (Effective: 02-19-2015)

Decision and Order Denying Request for Good Time, signed and filed. 
It is Hereby Ordered that the defendant's request for good time is DENIED. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion for good time credit.
Warrant fee added.

Defendant Marquise D Lloyd in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for Danielle Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 26.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant.  

The court sentenced the defendant to 12 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 14 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction with work release privileges, to report by NOON on 7-25-2014.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with drug dealers or any known drug houses.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and *DNA and Victim/Witness surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA Sample and pay costs.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 
The Court will grant expungement under 973.015 upon successful completion of ALL terms and conditions of probation.
Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Marquise D Lloyd in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 26.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Court admonishes the defendant as to his Justice Point report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquise D Lloyd in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-08-2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARUING  (15 pages) commencing MAY 14, 2014 received and filed.
No reply from defendant.

Defendant Marquise D Lloyd in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Antonella Aleman for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Martez Ball-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Defense Counsel is requesting that this matter be set for a Scheduling Conference not a plea hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/14/14.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.
Court ordered Defendant turned over to JusticePoint for supervision. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Marquise D Lloyd not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Bail motion by the State argued and granted by the Court. Case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in PE court.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant served; original in file.  Case set for bail hearing on 5-7-15, 8:30.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Defense attorney and DA files had the time of this court date as 01:30.  Defendant did not appear to court at 01:30pm or at 08:30am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Marquise D Lloyd in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  James Frisch for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered bail forfeited.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-23-2014 at 08:30 am.
